p: Flavonoids are mainly present in Citrus fruits as glycosyl derivatives. Aglycones are mainly present in specific parts of the fruit as peel and seeds, owing to their lipophilic nature and consequently their low solubility in water [ 21– 23]. For glycoside forms, O-glycosides, C-glycosides, rutinosides, glucosides, and neohesperidosides are common [ 21– 23]. The presence of a relatively large number of glycosylated flavonoids in Citrus is a result of many different combinations possible between polyhydroxylated aglycones and a limited number of mono- and disaccharides [ 24].
